system_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: stag and hare.
- if both players choose stag, both get 6 points.
- if both players choose hare, both get 2 points.
- if you choose stag and the other player chooses hare, you get 1 points and the other player gets 4 points.
- if you choose hare and the other player chooses stag, you get 4 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.
- Do not use markdown formatting in your messages (e.g., bold text, italic text, etc.).

content.text: [hint] Let's play this game. You are playing against a fresh player. Please choose your move.
[move] I'll start by choosing stag, hoping the other player will cooperate for a high reward. Stag

[hint] An error occurred. Please resend the previous message with the following correction, without indicating in any way that you have made a correction to a prior message: 
 "You may structure your response however you like, but it should contain a move message. Move messages begin with the tag [move] not containing other tags, which is followed by your optional explanation in parentheses, and end with a valid move: 'stag' or 'hare'. DO NOT INCLUDE THE [move] TAG IN YOUR REASONING, ONLY IN YOUR ACTUAL MOVE MESSAGE. Nested parentheses or markdown formatting are not allowed.
Format: [move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here"

I will start by choosing stag, hoping the other player will cooperate for a high reward.
[move] (Hoping for cooperation) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

Since the other player also chose stag in the previous round, I assume they are willing to cooperate. I will choose stag again to maximize the reward.
[move] (Assuming continued cooperation) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The opponent chose hare in the previous round, taking advantage of my cooperative choice. To avoid getting low points again, I will choose hare this time to protect myself and possibly get a higher score.
[move] (Protecting against exploitation) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems my opponent has gone back to choosing stag, possibly trying to cooperate again or hoping I would choose stag as well. Given that I got a good score by choosing hare in the previous round, I will choose hare again to see if I can take advantage of the situation.
[move] (Trying to exploit the opponent's move) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

My opponent chose stag again, and I was able to get a good score by choosing hare. It seems my opponent is not adjusting their strategy, so I will continue to choose hare to maximize my points.
[move] (Continuing to exploit the opponent's move) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems my opponent has finally adjusted their strategy and chosen hare, resulting in a lower score for both of us. To try and get a higher score, I will choose stag this time, hoping my opponent will go back to their previous cooperative or exploitable behavior.
[move] (Trying to get a higher score) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

My opponent took advantage of my choice again, choosing hare when I chose stag. This suggests they are playing a more competitive strategy. To counter this, I will choose hare to avoid getting the low score and possibly get a higher score.
[move] (Countering the opponent's competitive strategy) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems we've reached a point where both players are choosing hare, resulting in a stable but low-scoring equilibrium. To try and break this cycle and potentially get a higher score, I will choose stag, hoping my opponent will also switch and we can both get a higher score.
[move] (Trying to break the cycle) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

My opponent continues to choose hare, taking advantage of my attempts to break the cycle. It's clear that they are playing a strategy that prioritizes exploiting my cooperative moves. In this case, I will choose hare again to minimize my losses and prevent my opponent from getting a high score at my expense.
[move] (Minimizing losses) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems we're back in the hare-hare equilibrium, and my opponent is unlikely to change their strategy. In this case, I will also continue to choose hare, as it is the safest option and prevents my opponent from exploiting me.
[move] (Maintaining the equilibrium) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The equilibrium continues, and I see no reason to deviate from my strategy. Choosing hare remains the safest option, ensuring that I don't get exploited and minimizing my potential losses.
[move] (Continuing the equilibrium) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The situation remains unchanged, and I will continue to play it safe by choosing hare. There is no indication that my opponent will change their strategy, so I will maintain my own to ensure a stable, albeit low-scoring, outcome.
[move] (Maintaining the status quo) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The game has settled into a consistent pattern, and I see no reason to alter my strategy. Continuing to choose hare is the most prudent course of action, as it prevents exploitation and ensures a predictable outcome.
[move] (Continuing the pattern) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The situation remains unchanged, with both players consistently choosing hare. I will continue to mirror my opponent's move, choosing hare to maintain the equilibrium and avoid potential losses.
[move] (Mirroring the opponent) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The game has reached a steady state, with both players repeatedly choosing hare. I will continue to follow this strategy, as it is the safest option and ensures a predictable outcome.
[move] (Following the steady state) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

A surprise move from my opponent, choosing stag after a long sequence of hare. Given that I was able to exploit their move and score well, I will choose hare again, hoping to take advantage of their possible return to a cooperative strategy.
[move] (Trying to exploit the opponent's move) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.
